data.title: Still ok, used to be better
data.text: I've been dining at Takanami for about 6 years and while it used to be awesome as a sushi-infusion restaurant, it seems to have gone to average over the past year.  I used to come here at least once a month for business and the 2 owners were constantly in and conversing and checking in.  That doesn't happen any more and makes me wonder if they have new owners?  The wait staff doesn't seem to have the attention or the will to care anymore either.  Food is average, not bad, but I would rather go to a sushi restaurant that cares about it's customers than here.

data.title: Somewhat disappointing lately
data.text: I used to really enjoy Takanami for their quality sushi. On my recent visits, however, I found the sushi to be sloppily and carelessly made. There was way too much sauce slathered all over my rolls which made them look unappealing. The abundance of sauce drown out some of the flavors of the rolls as well. My sashimi was carelessly cut as well and the portions seemed smaller than before. The sushi isn't cheap so it's too bad that the quality seems to be slipping. Next time I'll be going to another place to get my sushi fix.

data.title: Great sushi at wonderful price!
data.text: My family and I LOVE to eat at Takanami restaurant!  We try to request a window seat because watching people walk up and down the Iowa City street proves very entertaining and interesting.  The service is wonderful - everyone is friendly and helpful in regard to menu questions.  The sweet potato roll is AMAZING, and our favorite sushi roll is the Takanami Dynamite.  Very reasonable prices!!

data.title: East/West in Iowa City
data.text: Nice atmosphere and good pacific rim food in downtown Iowa City.  Interesting small bar in the back of the restaurant with daily drink specials. Good sushi.  Excellent service.  .

data.title: Very good sushi at good price
data.text:
I had  a spring roll and avocado roll, both quite good. The beer was also good. Staff courteous and we got served in short time.
With a friend we ended up paying less than $30 with a shared dessert. But it was happy hour, other wise it would have been more than that.
I don't eat sushi quite often but if I get in the mood this would certainly be my first choice

data.title: Best Sushi in Iowa City
data.text: Beautiful weather made the sidewalk café portion a real treat; plus the sushi was fresh & delicious.  And the happy hour martinis were extraordinary.

data.title: Second Date; Always Visiting
data.text: My husband and I had our second date here where he introduced me to sushi. I'll forever be thankful!  Good sushi for starters, not pricey drinks, and after hours a fun bar on the back. Love the outdoor patio - very fun on summer nights after class.

data.title: First visit in a decade. Food & service MUCH improved.
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the much improved food, happy hour menu specials and service.  It's central downtown Iowa City, and the expanded space makes Takanami an excellent option for Japanese food and sushi..  The one recommendation I have is that they serve at least one Asian or Japanese dessert or ice cream.

data.title: Best sushi in the corridor!
data.text: This sushi is the best. My favorite is the kobe tempura but I haven't found a bad item on the menu yet! Service is great! Wonderful place for a date.  We go here to celebrate anniversaries and birthdays.

data.title: Bento Box Special is "Special"
data.text: Great downtown location.  Had lunch with friends and we ordered the Bento Box lunch special.  I   ordered the seared tuna Bento Box which was outstanding.  Great service and reasonably priced.  Definitely will be back for sushi and other menu options.

data.title: Japanese Food
data.text: Price is a little higher than expected. Nice variety. Atmosphere is nice. Food is good. Location is in a good spot.

data.title: Love the Sushi at Takanami!
data.text: This is our go to place for Sushi.  We often get it take out and everyone is happy with the variety and quality.  The Bento Box specials at lunch are delicious and you get a lot of food for a reasonable price.  They have always been accommodating when we had special food requirements.  Busy and fun in the evenings.  The coolest bathrooms in any restaurant -- at least the women's is that way!

data.title: Good Japanese Style
data.text: Love this place, I really enjoy their sushi and they always have some nice fish selections. Food is always well seasoned and nicely presented!

data.title: Excellent sushi and kobe beef
data.text: My husband and I went once with friends and we will definitely be back. The food and service were excellent. It's a bit pricey but well worth the money.

data.title: Other review almost scared us off - glad it did not
data.text: Went when during the week and it was almost empty. So our service was just fine. The sushi rolls were priced fair and really tasty. We really enjoyed it and would go back again. Still a little nerves about service next time given all the other comments, but like I said we had a very good meal this time.

data.title: Carryout is the way to go
data.text:
Had ate at this restaurant before and I got to admit..it's nothing special; it's actually somewhat cluttered with tables being so close together and this big fish tank in the middle, which I got to admit somewhat cool, but would rather have more space available from other table than to see the fish.

Although, my last experience was a bit more apealling since we just ordered it to go.  Had the kobe roll, some kind of crab salad roll, two others which I can't recall from the top of my head but one was for sure covered in green sauce and hot mayo, and for our money we got a lot of sushi...7 pieces/roll...more or less; more than likely less, but rough estimate.  All seemed right on point with their taste, and freshness; Was actually pleasantly surprised.  Would highly recommend this restaurant for sushi if someone was looking to: *STAY IN THE DOWNTOWN SCENE OF IOWA CITY*, but not the best I've had in Iowa City.  Oyama definitely takes that prize from me.

data.title: Good good but very poor air quality
data.text: The food choices were varied from Japanese to American.  The Kobe beef was incredible.  I wish the atmosphere was less "smokey" from the cooking

data.title: Terrible service, good food
data.text: Some of the worst service I have had in Iowa City in a long time and I eat out often.  Week night, not busy. Didn't get 3 things we ordered, slow to check back--really surprised they can survive if this is indicative.  Maybe the sushi bar is the place to sit but no one was even sitting there--I guess I will never know since I don't plan on going back.

data.title: Sushi was fantastic
data.text: My daughter and I had a wonderful meal of sushi and wine.  I'm from Los Angeles where sushi restaurants are everywhere.  I wasn't sure what to expect in Iowa City but I was happily surprised!  The yellowtail was fresh and perfectly presented and the California Roll was excellent.  Nice ambiance!  Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Average food with average to bad service
data.text: We went on a Sunday evening and they maybe had 5-6 other tables, so not real busy is my point.  We ordered and the original order came out fairly fast, but when she dropped off the sushi we ordered another roll.  After 20 minutes and everyone else at the table basically finished with dinner I asked her about the other roll, "Oh, let me check on it".  I watched her as she went to the sushi station and picked it up...it was there she just forgot.  I ordered the Kobe roll ($11) and it was so charred it had a bad taste, made it extremely difficult to eat.  I also ordered the Rangoon’s which $9 for 5...way overpriced.  There "entree" menu does not make since, you need to offer better/more options there are some people who don't eat sushi.  They should offer bento boxes at night too, really no reason not to. Then to top it off I had one of their new offers that they advertise $10 off $50 plus I had a gift certificate that was purchased, the waitress came back stating they can't take both, someone needs to tell them that there is a difference between a coupon and a gift certificate.  Overall experience was average or below.  Much better sushi options in town and with more and more springing up they need to step up their game.  In the future I will not be back and will go to Konomi in the future.  I think this place thinks it is in downtown Chicago not downtown Iowa City.
